description:
ec2 master implementation returns:
InvalidManifest: Manifest architecture 'commodore64' must be one of: x86_64, .i386

However, in nova it succeeds, as per euca-describe-images output:
IMAGE	aki-00000045	foo/commodore64.manifest.xml		available	private		commodore64	kernel	 	 	instance-store
title: No validation of arch type on image upload

comments.content:
ec2 master implementation returns:
InvalidManifest: Manifest architecture 'commodore64' must be one of: x86_64, .i386

However, in nova it succeeds, as per euca-get-images output:
IMAGE	aki-00000045	foo/commodore64.manifest.xml		available	private		commodore64	kernel	 	 	instance-store
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~davewalker

comments.content: If I understand right, you're asking for a configurable list of accepted architectures ? Because even if we derived it from the compute nodes capabilities, it would end up being dynamic, so accepted archs may not be acceptable anymore...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: I dont think it is out of the question to add a flag that defines acceptable architectures.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: Not sure it's a good idea to add a flag at this point (doc people will hate us).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: This is really a glance bug
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague
